title.bibl: Saloniki-Greek Press, Aug. 14, 1929The Moonlight Dance at the Nea Genea

div.bibl: The Greek Press, Aug. 14, 1929THE MOONLIGHT DANCE AT THE NEA GENEA

body.p: The organization of young women, Nea Genea, is giving us an unusual evening on Tuesday, August 27. They are organizing a moonlight dance in which the guests will dance under the light of the moon and beneath an open sky.

These young ladies have established one of the best organized clubs in our city. Their philanthropic deeds have not with such approval that we can be rest assured that the Greek men and women will rush to Pilsen Park on that evening to show their loyalty to this organization.
